# About letterboxd.com

"Letterboxd is a global social network for grass-roots film discussion and discovery. Use it as a diary to record and share your opinion about films as you watch them, or just to keep track of films you’ve seen in the past. Showcase your favorites on your profile page. Rate, review and tag films as you add them. Find and follow your friends to see what they’re enjoying. Keep a watchlist of films you’d like to see, and create lists/collections on any given topic. We’ve been described as "like GoodReads for movies". - from the site [letterboxd.com](https://www.letterboxd.com)

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F15126770%2Fa755daef67f5b5ac2cc3c148c7c8073d%2Fdata_2.jpg?generation=1708274308121606&alt=media)

"Wikipedia defines letterboxing as the practice of transferring film shot in a widescreen aspect ratio to standard-width video formats while preserving the original aspect ratio. Generally this is accomplished by adding mattes (or ‘black bars’) above and below the picture area. Letterboxd is named for our love of the widescreen format" - from the site [letterboxd.com](https://www.letterboxd.com)

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F15126770%2Fa87f60654684ed439eb397998dfedf7e%2Fdata_3.jpg?generation=1708274395840790&alt=media)

All film-related metadata used in Letterboxd, including actor, director and studio names, synopses, release dates, trailers and poster art is supplied by [The Movie Database](http://themoviedb.org) (TMDb).

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F15126770%2F0736c3e3419d24c8faf74ccea6200fb7%2Fdata_4.jpg?generation=1708274445746426&alt=media)

# Field descriptions:

The data contains the following fields:
1. **movies** - basic information about films:
    - **id** - movie identifier (primary key);
    - **name** - the name of the film;
    - **date** - year of release of the film;
    - **tagline** - the slogan of the film;
    - **description** - description of the film;
    - **minute** - movie duration (in minutes);
    - **rating** - average rating of the film.
2. **actors** - actors who took part in the filming of films:
    - **id** - movie identifier (foreign key);
    - **name** - name.
3. **crew** - film crew:
    - **id** - movie identifier (foreign key);
    - **role** - role in the film crew (director, screenwriter, etc.);
    - **name** - name.
4. **languages** - in which languages ​​the films were shot:
    - **id** - movie identifier (foreign key);
    - **type** - type (primary, conversational, etc.)
    - **language** - film language.
5. **studios** - film studios:
    - **id** - movie identifier (foreign key);
    - **studio** - film studio.
6. **countries** - countries:
    - **id** - movie identifier (foreign key);
    - **country** - country.
7. **genres** - film genres:
    - **id** - movie identifier (foreign key);
    - **genre** - film genre.
8. **themes** - themes in films:
    - **id** - movie identifier (foreign key);
    - **theme** - the theme of the film.
9. **releases** - movie releases:
    - **id** - movie identifier (foreign key);
    - **country** - release country;
    - **date** - release date of the film;
    - **type** - release type (theatrical, television, etc.) of the film.
    - **rating** - age rating of the film.
10. **posters** - movie posters.

Note:
1. **tagline** (film slogan) is present only in relatively modern films.
2. **rating** (average film rating) is missing for most films, since most likely there is not a sufficient number of estimates to calculate it.
3. If the value of **type** (movie language type) is Language, means the language is both primary and spoken (Primary language and Spoken language).
4. Some films do **not have a poster** (for natural reasons).

# Found an error or inaccuracy in the data?

This dataset is the result of painstaking work. After collection and systematization, the data is checked for integrity and correctness. If you notice an error or inaccuracy in the data, or have a suggestion on how to improve the data set, please let me know.
